snippet: The Japanese carmaker said it was recalling all 1.9 million latest-generation Prius cars sold worldwide because of a defect in the vehicle’s hybrid system.
abstract: Toyota Motor is recalling all of 1.9 million newest-generation Prius vehicles it has sold worldwide because of programming error that could cause their gas-electric hybrid systems to shut down.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and JACLYN TROP
byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi reported from Tokyo, and Jaclyn Trop from Detroit.

lead_paragraph: The Japanese carmaker said it was recalling all 1.9 million latest-generation Prius cars sold worldwide because of a defect in the vehicle’s hybrid system.

headline.main: Toyota Recalls Newest Priuses Over Software
headline.print_headline: Toyota Recalls Newest Priuses Over Software
